column4: Anyone, I have a laptop where I was upgrading to 11.04 - I fount it with the Caps Lock light blinking, and the hardrive light on. Power down and try to reboot gets a Kernel Panic - not syncing: VFS: Unable to mount root fs on unknown block.
was this a upgarde from another distro?
yes, from 10.10
escott makes a good suggestion, beyond that I would see if the HD mounts from a live cd and pull out what you need and do a fresh install.
I think escott will know more about checking the hardware.
hit ctrl-f put in the nd and search to find al lthe posts of that nic
a dist-upgrade is a safe move generally.
you might comsider having a image of a working setup in case you have problems.
when you hit print there is a dropdown in the gui for where it is pointed.
where? for example 'text edit' shows me Print to File - not the CUPS server printer on the mac
what are you trying to print, open libre, and type a few thing and hit the not quick print and a gui should show.
the file-printersetting in libre should show it.
what is libre - I am trying open office and the print menus hangs.
open office the same in the file tab is printer settings
Print is still hanging
I know with mine I have a old HP Black and white printer the driver is not exctly the one ubuntu suggests, mine has a plus at end the driver I use has all other identification - the plus.
I kill it, Printer Settings also hangs
that is about all I know that I have posted. ;(
I kill that also, trying  Text Edit - it gives me only Print to File option
that is about all I know that I have posted. ;(
np
